audio_caption: The audio begins with at least one female speaker with a casual, conversational tone, excited about cosplaying after a nap.  She says "1 o'clock and we're finally getting into cosplay", and other speakers chime in describing it as "the biggest nap". One speaker with a slightly higher pitch makes a joke and they discuss having chips and wanting Starbucks.  A car honks loudly in the background. A different woman speaks in a teasing voice that it's "like two in the afternoon".  There is general chatter, and one voice is heard saying "there's three deputy shooters". The speaker with the most prominent voice states they are the only one going out and announce they are at the "promised land of caffeine", sounding excited to "get caffeine". Traffic noise intensifies. A playful call of "caffeine gods" is heard. Then there is a distinct male voice doing a silly impression with the phrase "he got the ice, he got the hot, he's icey hot". The speaker switches to the Starbucks edition, followed by a female speaker saying "there he go now yeet your hot side". There is a brief exchange about being "dead" and a statement that there are "totally spies down there" and expressing excitement. There is mention of finding Nikki's best friend and a mock offended tone suggesting "I thought I was her best friend". Some back and forth ensues, including a comment about being "lovers". A speaker enthusiastically declares "We did it!" and states "We're here".  Another speaker says they have "got the place" and will have to find things now.

The clip begins with two female voices discussing nerdy towels for their house. There's mention of something switching from "nukes" to "this."  One expresses delight at seeing "Miss Frizzle."  Another asks to take a picture. The audio then shifts to a woman saying they've lost someone at the Gremlin booth. She calls out, "Hey Nikki," pointing out the Geico Gecko. Nikki expresses excitement at seeing the Gecko. The woman laments the abundance of butterflies. Another voices her desire to recreate some photos, with a hint of apprehension about being eaten. Throughout, there is a fairly consistent background buzz, with what sounds like crowd noise, suggesting a busy environment like a convention or a trade show.

The clip begins with a light, upbeat female voice saying, "We'll see, we'll figure it out. Yeah." Another female voice expresses excitement about seeing "the sailor moon dolls of her dreams", calling it a "her childhood," and "so precious." This is followed by music featuring a synthesizer-like sound playing a melodic tune with a bouncy tempo. Subsequently, an unidentified person or group sings "Jabba the hut", then "And Mega Man." The female voice returns, saying, "Tomorrow is gonna be Ray day over in this section" and commenting that something is "moving." Someone describes something as "horrifying", followed by more speech about what is not a child in a costume. Someone then says "for sustenance", followed by another voice saying "creeping in the restaurant." The clip transitions back to synthesized music similar to earlier, which is followed by another voice saying "Texas Peach Berry Smash", and more speech with a female voice lamenting whether something "was it worth it?" and another voice saying, "No." The clip concludes with more speech saying, "Oh, you're not worth it."

The clip begins with someone saying "Texas Peach Berry Smash" in a fairly neutral tone, followed by a drawn-out "Mm" and a wow indicating approval and surprise. Another person is then heard enthusiastically mentioning cheesets, conveying excitement and surprise, before stating they've eaten all of them. Finally, someone offhandedly states "Best friend cheeset buddies" followed by a less audible statement about the last run. The background features ambient chatter, suggesting the recording was taken in a busy or social environment.

The audio clip begins with two female speakers excitedly referencing a necklace. One woman inquires about her "best friend's necklace." The other responds it has "been in my bag all day." The first woman mentions wearing hers all day. There is an interjection, and the woman expresses she was going to wear hers, but wasn't sure. A speaker remarks, "these two are ridiculous." Someone mentions they'll wear it tomorrow, because they have layers and are "not ashamed." Someone says "not ashamed of being best friends." The final remark is, "it's too bad I don't have a best friend."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing excitement about food, declaring it "delicious." A female speaker then comments that one of the servers wants to cosplay Mirio next year, adding "also delicious." Background chatter is present. Another male speaker says "Yes." Finally, a female speaker expresses concern, asking "What did you do?", "Where'd you go? What did you do?".

The audio begins with a female speaker remarking about spilled coffee on the floor, followed by another person's declaration that it was "Amanda" who did it. The first female speaker expresses frustration, asking if Amanda was "twerking." There's a quick burst of laughter, and then a comment about being "horrified" and a promise not to pop out "anywhere." One of the speakers states that she's going to issue a "stern discipline." Another person seems to give the cue from "behind this door" which results in the beginning of a "live action recreation." Someone suggests you "walk past" with the comment "that's horrifying." followed by "what's going on here?". A sudden vocal sound is followed by laughter. Someone states that they were afraid of someone having to pee and ruin the room. Finally, the audio concludes with the sentiment "this is just..."

The audio clip begins with a female voice humorously remarking "Your knees look like boobs," followed by a male speaker, expressing concern, addressing someone as "Deku" and asking, "Are you okay... You having a moment?". The first female voice follows this remarking on someone's hands, stating "Your hands look so creepy... my creepy skeleton hands." Another male speaker comments, "Creepy skeleton hands, creepy ghost body". A brief pause is followed by a query about claw hands. A surprised "Wow" is audible. An exclamation is heard followed by speech indicating someone is breaking clothing. Another speaker indicates "Brokies going away" suggesting someone will soon be speaking. Then, another voice says, "Oh God".

The clip begins with one person, possibly female, saying "Hello." There's a brief burst of laughter, and someone then says "That's gay." Then another person says "We can get more gay." A third speaker chimes in with "Oh, oh," followed by an indiscernible sound. The second speaker, possibly female, adds "I like how that was just naturally an invitation for just more of a show," with some laughter. Someone else then says "More gay, more gay, you got it," followed by, "Acknowledge gay equals more gay." Another voice says, "That's too bad, I ship this. I don't ship All Might and Present Mic," followed by another speaker calling it weird. This is followed by an indiscernible sound and finally someone claiming that it's okay.

The audio clip begins with two females in conversation. One female asks a question about vlogging during a prior event. The other female responds, "Way to go, Rachel," followed by an overlapping conversation with the first female discussing filming a sketch. A male voice interjects by saying "Fight me," followed by the instruction "Do it." There's a sound of physical contact, like a hit. The male voice yells, followed by an unidentified exclamation. A description continues with "Slow motion gets decked," alongside background noises like speech and the word "smash." An additional female voice describes avoiding breaking lights, implying physical activity or movement in a shared space. Overall, the conversation and noises indicate an informal setting with a playful interaction and physical activity.

The audio clip features high-pitched voices of two young speakers, one male and one female, seemingly engaged in a playful, chaotic interaction. The male speaker says "and then we livestream everything" and then mentions someone possibly "hopping on my head". The female exclaims "oh my god that's my husband!". The male speaker states "Help me I saw". Their tone is excited and playful, with occasional outbursts of laughter. A possible third speaker joins in with, "I know, but only I get to do that". This transitions to the original two speakers laughing, and the male says "Let's paint him up together". The female then cries "Oh shit!" and the male speaker follows with, "Crush his head like a grape," and another "that'll be the". The male questions, "Did you just want the eye?" followed by another female speaker saying, "Wow. Wow." and the male adds, "That's quite graphic Bakugo." The female speaker replies, "because you're twelve," and the male says "You damn twelve-year-old." The first female speaker then says "No, that doesn't make it better. No." The male responds, "Plus ultra." Another speaker says they're "thinking of so many bad jokes", with another female interrupting "why am I like your secret love child because I also put a dick on this song" followed by a loud laugh. The speaker continues that "Bakugo is clearly compensating" which is followed by a higher pitched laugh. One speaker is heard to say "This is my son" and followed by another speaker saying, "There's a reason I gave him my power to-" which is cut off by another speaker to say "go into bed."

The audio clip opens with a female voice declaring it is time for a shower, followed by another female voice suggesting it would be economical for all four of them to shower at the same time. This elicits laughter. Another female speaker comments on the absurdity of the idea, and a third female speaker suggests that the idea would be problematic because of who they are cosplaying. Next, a female voice announces that it's time to shower and then sleep. Someone, presumably female, remarks on how dark it is, and another woman says "Good." followed by the sounds of a brief breathy chuckle.

The clip begins with a giggle and a speech segment in which a female speaker says, "human." This is followed by what sounds like a second female speaker expressing confusion and disbelief, indicated by her words "I'm sorry, what?" and "Did you say earlier you liked to eat cheesesticks in the shower and now you're doing this?" A male speaker interjects with a brief statement, then the first female speaker states that she also eats mashed potatoes in the shower. The second female speaker expresses surprise, "Wait, actually?" The first speaker responds in the affirmative and states "I like to eat food in the shower", which is followed by more surprise and disbelief from the second speaker. The clip concludes with a brief comment from one of the female speakers, "Why not?".
